title: Youth Guidance Centres and NEET Services – Baltic Sea Network
content: Kick-off Meeting | Krakow, Poland | 10–12 March 2026 The EU Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region (EUSBSR) Policy Area Education invites stakeholders to the kick-off meeting of the Youth Guidance Centres and NEET Services Baltic Sea Network , taking place in Krakow, Poland, from 10 to 12 March 2026 . Across Europe, young people’s labour market conditions have deteriorated since 2008, with persistent challenges for those not in employment, education, or training (NEETs). Youth Guidance Centres – als...
creator: Asli TepecikDis
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Creeping crises in the Baltic Sea Region: Challenges and strategies
content: Today the Baltic Sea Region faces slow-building, often compounding threats: pressure on critical infrastructure (energy grids, subsea cables, ports), mounting strains on fragile critical societal functions (food and medicine supply, banking, digital services), climate-driven multi-hazards (coastal flooding, droughts, wildfires). “Why don’t our leaders take decisive, sustained action to stop these threats from developing into acute crises with devastating consequences for societies?” ...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Hazardous substances and the Baltic Sea: Why a holistic approach matters
content: Hazardous substances (HAZ) that are widely marketed and used inevitably find their way into the Baltic Sea, where they become pollutants. Even chemicals that are not toxic in their original form can break down or transform into harmful micropollutants. Examples include pharmaceutical residues, certain members of the PFAS family, and brominated flame retardants. Evidence is mounting that the overall toxic burden on our aquatic environment is already far beyond what ecosystems can handle. A drasti...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: CPMR Baltic Sea and North Sea Regions Unite to Strengthen Security, Resilience, and Cooperation
content: Regional leaders from across Northern Europe gathered on 28-29 January in Stockholm, Sweden, for a joint meeting and seminar of the CPMR Baltic Sea Commission and the CPMR North Sea Commission Executive Committees. Representing 47 regional authorities , the Executive Committees adopted a Political Declaration calling for Reinforced Regional Cooperation in Northern Europe to increase Competitiveness, Resilience, Sustainability, and Security. Amid growing geopolitical tensions, hybrid threats and ...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: 4 Awarded Cultural Pearls title holders begin their actions in 2026
content: After an intense journey that started in February 2025, the selection of the 2026 Cultural Pearls has been announced: Municipalities Glücksburg (DE), Kristinestad-Kristiinankaupunki (FI), Krosno (PL) and Schleswig (DE) will continue their path toward strengthening social resilience through culture as Baltic Sea Region Cultural Pearls 2026. In total, 11 highly motivated candidates reached the final round, expanding the Cultural Pearls Network across the Baltic Sea Region. Throughout the process, ...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Interreg NPA launches the first Youth Call
content: The Interreg Northern Periphery and Arctic (NPA) Programme is officially launching its first Youth Call. The Youth Call aims to support youth-led ideas and initiatives that address key challenges and opportunities in the NPA area, including sustainable development, climate resilience, innovation, inclusion, and community wellbeing. By placing young people at the centre of project development and implementation, the call encourages meaningful youth participation and long-term regional impact. “Th...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Save the Date: BSSSC Day of Cities and Regions 2026 in Tallinn
content: Save the date for the BSSSC Day of Cities and Regions 2026 in Tallinn! Join cities and regions from across the Baltic Sea Region as we work together to build secure, connected and thriving societies through collaborative resilience governance. On 11 May 2026, the Baltic Sea States Subregional Cooperation (BSSSC) will host the Day of Cities and Regions in Tallinn, Estonia. The event’s theme is “Co-Governing Resilience: Shaping Secure, Connected and Thriving Societies”. This event will bring toget...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Culture Compass for Europe
content: Shaping the EU’s future through culture The European Commission has launched a new strategic framework called the Culture Compass for Europe, designed to put culture at the heart of EU policy-making and to shape the future of cultural and creative life across Europe. The initiative aims to support artists and cultural professionals, promote cultural rights and democratic values, and enhance the contribution of culture to social cohesion, resilience, and economic competitiveness. It provides a co...
creator: Franziska Kapteina
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: At the Heart of Artificial Intelligence Research: Winter School of Innovation 2025
content: The Winter School of Innovation is a new pilot initiative under the EU Strategy for the Baltic Sea Region (EUSBSR) Policy Area Innovation, created to support young researchers by responding to unmet educational needs in innovation and artificial intelligence. As discussions within the EUSBSR increasingly emphasize the meaningful involvement of young people across all levels of cooperation, the School directly addresses this call by empowering those who will shape the Region’s future innovation l...
creator: Aino-Maija Koljonen
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region

title: Unlocking the potential of AI in the Baltic Sea Region: A path towards sustainable and inclusive transformation
content: Artificial Intelligence (AI) has rapidly developed into a critical driver of economic and societal transformation. In the Baltic Sea Region, AI offers unique opportunities to tackle shared challenges in sustainability, economic competitiveness, social cohesion and safety and security. The pace and direction of this transformation can be significantly influenced by coordinated policy action and joint strategic investments in AI-driven digital infrastructure, services and skills. The Baltic Sea Re...
creator: Anja
sourceDescription: EU Strategy For The Baltic Sea Region
